title.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, Dec. 9, 1913. Sabath Wins Important Point

div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, Dec. 9, 1913. SABATH WINS IMPORTANT POINT

body.p: Congressman Adolph J. Sabath, who is a member of the Committee on Immigration, today won a victory at the committee meeting. The Immigration Committee is at present working on the well-known Barnett-Dillingham Immigration Bill.

The Jewish congressman has waged a battle during the last three meeting days. He demanded that the committee be open-minded and permit, before the bill goes to Congress, the defenders of the open door policy to a hearing on this important question.

Finally, the committee complied with Mr. Sabath's demands. They set aside the 11th or 112th day of December to receive a Chicago committee and hear its arguments against the bill, which aims to close the doors of America.

As soon as the news reached Chicago, activities began among prominent citizens
to select and send a committee to the Immigration Committee in Congress. Election Commissioner Zarnetsky, and a member of the Board of Education, Mr. H. A. Lipsky, assumed the responsibility of organizing a suitable committee which will, if possible, be sent to Washington to argue for free entrance to this country.
